title: Change in p-value with one-sided alternative

content.description: A researcher conducted a <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test of the hypotheses <math alttext="H sub 0, colon, mu equals 38" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>38</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> versus <math alttext="H sub a, colon, mu is not equal to 38" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>38</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The sample mean was <math alttext="35" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and the <math alttext="p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value for the test was <math alttext="0.0627" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>0.0627</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>.
content.question: What would the <math alttext="p" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>p</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>-value have been if the researcher had used <math alttext="H sub a, colon, mu is less than 38" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo><</mo><mn>38</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> as the alternative hypothesis?

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
